description:
The method _poll_volume_usage() in nova/compute/manager.py generates a notification message recording data read and write counts to volumes, which it generates from libvirt.

To make these messages more useful for billing purposes the tenant id and user id should be included in the message for each volume.
title: Tenant and user id required in volume usage notification message

comments.content:
This bug is more serious than thought when it was opened.

The intance uuid in volume usage records is not being stored correctly in the database. In master, the instance_id field of volume_usage_cache is currently an integer, but the value passed to the function db.sqlalchemy.api.vol_usage_update() is a uuid. The value stored in volume_usage_cache is therefore corrupt, so no usable billing records for volume usage can be generated.

This means that any customer who needs to generate billing records based on volume usage will not be able to upgrade from folsum until this code has been merged.
